listitem.para: Explain how the ANF Model transforms the clinical statements into normalized data

section.title: Draft Transformation Content
section.para: In this chapter we will discuss how ANF helps transform clinical data into normalized data – it can help with reconciling data that is captured in a variety of mechanisms and make it compatible with other data, move it to another system, join it with other data, or aggregate information in the data. Ultimately, this will assist with use for CDS and patient safety.

EHR data will start off overly post-coordinated with the data potentially spread across multiple fields. By creating an ANF statement, one can take the disparate information and organize it so that the post-coordination is mostly contained in the topic representation instead of being spread across disparate fields.

For instance, there may be 1 clinical statement in an EHR for blood pressure measurement and care planning that might be 5 observations when represented by FHIR. There are many different ways to create the FHIR data structures.

para.emphasis: Challenges that will likely arise: You may have multiples. How is that a challenge? One would have to search for the 1st thing and then return and query that to find the next thing…

section.para: A current solution to minimize the variation by implementation is that healthcare organizations will make a choice to either use Assertion style vs. Evaluation Result and will not create the other format. When transferring data structures between and amongst institutions, these different styles may be a problem. The current approach is to solve the problem by conformity rather than with technology.

With ANF, we will be able to handle concrete domains by increasing the payload in the topic representation and by putting all of the topic details in a post-coordinated SNOMED CT expression. With ANF, with the increased specificity of the topic expression, there are not several different ways to represent the same clinical statement. In ANF, you can’t do the CIMI Evaluation Result style, because you can’t have a coded answer, that choice is taken away from you by the constructs of ANF. Qualifiers do change the meaning of data. With ANF, the things that change meaning are always in the topic. Whether something is a request or has occurred – this is not in the topic. That separation is okay because of xxx

Not having coded answers is a big paradigm shift. We need to describe the benefits. If ANF topic expression is created in correct way, you can query for all permutations of a concept with a single parent concept that can create them. In FHIR, one thing that is built in already is ability to search for attribute for resource that comes from a published value set.
